title: How to Make a No Bake Pie

steps.headline: Press the pie crust in place if you've made it from scratch.
steps.description: otherwise, remove the cover and have it sitting out ready.

steps.headline: Fold the yogurt and Cool Whip together.
Spread the mixture across the pie crust.
steps.description: Use a spatula and smooth it out evenly.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator.
steps.description: Allow to set; this will take a few hours.

steps.headline: Remove from the refrigerator when set.
steps.description: It's now ready to serve. Cut fresh fruit makes a perfect accompaniment.

steps.headline: Line a pie dish with parchment paper or greaseproof paper.
steps.description: This will help make sure that the pie doesn't stick to the dish.

steps.headline: Place the caramels and milk into a heavy-based saucepan.
steps.description: Cook over medium to low heat. Stir frequently, cooking until they all melt.

steps.headline: Pour into the pie dish.
steps.description: If using greaseproof paper, only pour when it has cooled a bit.

steps.headline: Place the chocolate chips, cream and butter into a new saucepan.
steps.description: Melt over low heat. Stir now and then until smooth.

steps.headline: Pour the smooth mixture over the caramel base.
Place in the refrigerator.
steps.description: Allow to chill until it sets. This will take about 4 hours.

steps.headline: Remove from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Serve with whipped cream.

steps.headline: Press the pie crust in place if you've made it from scratch.
steps.description: otherwise, remove the cover and have it sitting out ready.

steps.headline: Fold the Cool Whip and condensed milk together.
steps.description: Mix until smooth.

steps.headline: Add the remaining ingredients.
steps.description: Mix them all together.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture over the graham cracker base.
Place in the refrigerator.
steps.description: Chill for 4 to 6 hours or until set.

steps.headline: Removed from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Serve with whipped cream or fresh fruit.

methods.name: No bake strawberry Kool Aid pie

steps.headline: Press the pie crust in place if you've made it from scratch.
steps.description: otherwise, remove the cover and have it sitting out ready.

steps.headline: Fold the Cool Whip and condensed milk together.
steps.description: Mix until smooth.

steps.headline: Add the remaining ingredients.
steps.description: Mix to combine well.

steps.headline: Using a spatula, transfer to the pie dish.
steps.description: Smooth out evenly.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator to chill.
steps.description: Allow to set, approximately 2 to 4 hours.

steps.headline: Remove from the refrigerator for serving.
steps.description: Serve with whipped cream or fresh strawberries––or both.

text: No bake yogurt pie Press the pie crust in place if you've made it from scratch. otherwise, remove the cover and have it sitting out ready. Fold the yogurt and Cool Whip together.  Spread the mixture across the pie crust. Use a spatula and smooth it out evenly. Place in the refrigerator. Allow to set; this will take a few hours. Remove from the refrigerator when set. It's now ready to serve. Cut fresh fruit makes a perfect accompaniment. No bake chocolate caramel pie Line a pie dish with parchment paper or greaseproof paper. This will help make sure that the pie doesn't stick to the dish. Place the caramels and milk into a heavy-based saucepan. Cook over medium to low heat. Stir frequently, cooking until they all melt. Pour into the pie dish. If using greaseproof paper, only pour when it has cooled a bit. Place the chocolate chips, cream and butter into a new saucepan. Melt over low heat. Stir now and then until smooth. Pour the smooth mixture over the caramel base.  Place in the refrigerator. Allow to chill until it sets. This will take about 4 hours. Remove from the refrigerator. Serve with whipped cream. Millionaire pie Press the pie crust in place if you've made it from scratch. otherwise, remove the cover and have it sitting out ready. Fold the Cool Whip and condensed milk together. Mix until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients. Mix them all together. Pour the mixture over the graham cracker base.  Place in the refrigerator. Chill for 4 to 6 hours or until set. Removed from the refrigerator. Serve with whipped cream or fresh fruit. No bake strawberry Kool Aid pie Press the pie crust in place if you've made it from scratch. otherwise, remove the cover and have it sitting out ready. Fold the Cool Whip and condensed milk together. Mix until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients. Mix to combine well. Using a spatula, transfer to the pie dish. Smooth out evenly. Place in the refrigerator to chill. Allow to set, approximately 2 to 4 hours. Remove from the refrigerator for serving. Serve with whipped cream or fresh strawberries––or both.
